name: B. Vanya and Lanterns
statement:
Vanya walks late at night along a straight street of length , lit by
lanterns. Consider the coordinate system with the beginning of the
street corresponding to the point , and its end corresponding to the
point . Then the -th lantern is at the point . The lantern lights all
points of the street that are at the distance of at most from it, where
is some positive number, common for all lanterns. Vanya wonders: what is
the minimum light radius should the lanterns have to light the whole
street?
